about.title: About Me
paragraphs: Hi, I'm a Software Engineering student passionate about solving complex problems, usually using TypeScript, Python, and a few snacks. I focus on backend development, aiming to make solutions work right from the first try (no guarantees though).
NestJS and FastAPI are part of my daily toolkit, and I'm currently exploring frontend development to strengthen my full-stack profile.

Outside of coding, I spend time at the gym, looking for new libraries, or playing Overwatch (Genji main) with friends. I enjoy creating, learning, experimenting with new technologies, and constantly solving problems.

items.name: Sippy
items.description: Cross-platform mobile platform developed with a Node.js backend and a React Native frontend. The project stands out for its implementation of a scalable architecture capable of handling dynamic feed algorithms, distributed processing on Azure, and complex management of both relational and NoSQL databases.
contributions: Designed database schemas and RESTful APIs using NestJS.
Optimized NoSQL queries to enhance data retrieval performance.
Using GraphQL to streamline data fetching between frontend and backend.
Deployed and managed cloud services on Microsoft Azure.

items.name: Nasa Explorer
items.description: A spatial biology knowledge engine that uses AI to summarize NASA scientific publications. It enables researchers to explore decades of information using natural language processing and semantic search.
contributions: Deploying RAG-based AI services using NestJS.
Implementing vector databases for semantic search.
Creating data pipelines for processing scientific literature.
